column4: Hello, I did "sudo /etc/init.d/udev restart" in order to restart USB and now I cannot moount my USB Hardisk anymore, any suggestions ?
did you have an entry in /etc/fstab?
you rebooted after you restarted udev?
I should probably try that another time with my HD unplugged
I had not inserted anything manually
but it doesn't seem to be in fstab
sda   sda1  sda2  sda5  sda6  sda7  sdb   sdb1  (but I have a 2 windows partitions and the swap)
you only have one internal hdd, correct?
One internal, one external, (and was trying to plug in a USB flash drive, which also does not seem to work, but it is unplugged at this time)
ok that means the system sees your usb hdd.
look in /media to see if it was mounted
no it is not, but i can see it in "Places" toolbar, but it says cannot mount
I have to go now, I will try that soon.... thanks for the help :D
